title: US tightens H-1B rules: Lottery system scrapped; NASSCOM flags 'innovation' concerns
description: Nasscom, India's IT trade body, warns that a proposed shift in H-1B visa selection from a lottery to a salary-weighted system will harm US innovation and competitiveness. This change could disadvantage small businesses, research institutions, and early-career graduates, potentially weakening the vital pipeline of Indian talent crucial for US leadership in AI and reinforcing the Indo-US partnership.

title: 'Don't comment, post views': Army issues policy on use of social media apps
description: The Army has unveiled new social media guidelines for its personnel. While platforms like Instagram and YouTube are restricted to viewing and information gathering, users can share unclassified general information on messaging apps like WhatsApp and Signal with known contacts. LinkedIn is permitted for professional networking and job seeking purposes only.

The 31-year-old is now heading to the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru for further assessment. While a return date remains uncertain, Iyer is aiming for the Vijay Hazare Trophy, with clarity expected after assessment at the CoE.

title: Political scorecard in 2025: Top 10 winners and losers of this year

Arvind Kejriwal's AAP lost Delhi, and Prashant Kishor's political venture faltered, highlighting power's dynamic nature.

title: CBSE in 2025: A look back at the changes set to reshape board exams
description: CBSE will introduce wide-ranging reforms from the 2025–26 session, reshaping exams, curriculum, and student support. Class 10 board exams will become biannual from 2026, allowing score improvement. APAAR ID linkage is now mandatory for Classes 9–12. Exam fees have increased, while syllabi align with NCF 2023. New career guidance, mental health counselling models, and an AI-powered digital experience centre aim to reduce stress and modernise learning for students, parents, and schools nationwide and abroad too.

A hidden Arctic world: Methane mounds and life found 3.6 km below the Greenland Sea
description: Scientists have found a unique geological and biological complex deep in the Greenland Sea.  Methane hydrate mounds, formed by trapped methane and ice, were discovered along the Molloy Ridge.  These mounds support chemosynthetic organisms, life that thrives without sunlight.  This discovery offers new insights into Arctic oceanography and methane stability.

CAT 2025 results: 12 candidates score 100 percentile; 9 from non-engineering backgrounds
description: CAT 2025 results have been announced by IIM Kozhikode, with 12 candidates achieving a perfect 100 percentile. Of these, nine are from non-engineering backgrounds, reflecting academic diversity among top scorers. The exam saw participation from 2.58 lakh candidates, with a balanced gender and category-wise representation. Delhi emerged as the leading state among 100 percentile scorers. IIMs and 93 non-IIM institutions will now begin their admission shortlisting processes.

title: Watch: Bangladesh unrest: One killed after unidentified men hurl bomb from a flyover in Dhaka
description: One person was killed in a crude bomb explosion in the Bangladesh’s capital Dhaka on December 24, 2025. Police said a cocktail bomb exploded after likely being thrown from the nearby flyover.

title: H-1B in age of social media vetting: When tweets meet immigration rules for global talent
description: America’s H-1B visa process has picked up a new gatekeeper: your social media. A December 2025 State Department update asks H-1B applicants and H-4 dependants to keep their accounts public during visa processing, widening a review earlier used for student visas. For skilled workers, the shift is subtle but real—credentials still matter, but so does your digital footprint, and how it might be read.

description: A horrific accident on NH-48 saw a fuel tanker collide with a sleeper bus, igniting a blaze that claimed at least nine lives. The tanker driver perished, while some bus occupants escaped.

MDMA, LSD, ecstasy pills: Woman techie & boyfriend held for selling high-end drugs
description: Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing arrested four individuals, including three alleged drug peddlers, in a drug network bust. Officials seized a significant quantity of drugs, including OG, MDMA, LSD blots, and ecstasy pills, valued at over Rs 3 lakh. The operation revealed a sophisticated network involving online procurement and cryptocurrency payments.

title: B'day outing turns nightmare: IT manager 'gang raped' in CEO’s car; survivor recall horror
description: A private IT company manager alleged gang-rape by her CEO and an executive's husband in a moving car after a company party. The survivor claims she was drugged and molested by the CEO and raped by the executive's husband while the executive head was present. All three accused have been detained for questioning.

title: Shimla doctor, who thrashed patient sacked; govt finds act 'unbecoming of a public servant'
description: Himachal Pradesh government has terminated the services of Dr. Raghav Nirula, a senior resident doctor at IGMC Shimla, for assaulting a patient. An inquiry committee found his actions unbecoming of a public servant, leading to his dismissal under the Resident Doctor Policy 2025. The incident involved a scuffle with a patient, and an FIR has been lodged.

title: 75+ Merry Christmas messages, greetings, wishes and quotes
description: Christmas offers a welcome pause, emphasizing connection, kindness, and genuine joy. This season's significance stems from its roots in hope and renewal, expanding to universal themes of togetherness and generosity. Thoughtful messages, whether for family, friends, or colleagues, carry deep emotion and foster meaningful connections.

title: US tech companies’ reliance on Chinese batteries a problem? Pentagon concerned
description: America faces a critical challenge as both tech giants and the military grapple with heavy reliance on China for essential lithium-ion batteries. This dependency threatens national security, impacting AI development and modern weaponry. Efforts are underway to build a domestic battery industry, securing vital components and reducing foreign control.

title: Nvidia may have just admitted that it cannot take Amazon, Google & Microsoft in Cloud
description: Nvidia has shelved its ambitious plan to directly challenge cloud giants like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. The chipmaker is now refocusing its DGX Cloud division inward, prioritizing its own engineers' AI model development. This strategic pivot aims to protect Nvidia's dominant AI chip market share, estimated at over 80%, rather than pursuing cloud revenue.
